you know a little bit about us now

transformation it's amazing how many

complexities that
you don't have take a look at our

right now and whether you think this is

imagine the effort that goes into

like this across eight global data

we have great teams running our data

running data centers is not a business
differentiated for us and it probably

better for investors now a
transformation is is much more than just

hard-working technologists worldwide to
embrace a cloud transformation hasn't
been particularly simple at Morningstar
our technologists are distributed across
several semi-autonomous product groups
each with their own individual roadmaps
and team goals so to align all these
teams we first established a common set
of high level technology goals to
include the goals that I already spoke
about maximizing talent and owning less
infrastructure we talked about reducing
complexity not just in technology but
also in our processes and the way we
work together we talked about improving
product completeness and focusing on
more than just product functionality but
also focusing on product security
product recoverability product
reliability we talked about increasing
uptime and the importance of better
monitoring and faster Incident Response
and over time we've been able to weave
these goals into our culture through a
lot of intentional repetition in
meetings and blogs and presentations and
conversations the goals were designed to
be very simple to understand easy to
repeat and non-expiring and this has
really paved the way for AWS because our
move to AWS supports each of these goals
in very very specific ways so don't be
passive about your culture because if
someone said you'll end up becoming what
you settle for now that the team is
super excited about moving to AWS a lot
of teams are doing a lot of important
things I'd like to talk about one of the
one of the teams here we asked a data
collection team to move a hugely
important data collection application to
AWS and they employed a lift and shift
strategy to get us into the cloud
quickly you see this here on the left
once they got everything working they
began to reduce complexity first by
replacing sequel server with RDS for
Postgres we added Kinesis for messaging
so that we'd have better control over
workload distribution then understanding
the application was only active two to
four hours a day we replaced all the ec2
instances with lambda functions and
committed to a strategy to create and
destroy the entire compute environment
on demand this this reduction in
complexity continued until we landed on
the solution that you see here on the
right so through a lot of creative
thinking and an iteration check this out
from left to right we actually realize
that 97% reduction in cost
ninety-seven percent that's a huge
number granted this was a not the
biggest project ever but if it were
larger just think it's it would be like
$30,000 versus a million dollars this is
not an insignificant number and we're
just so encouraged that we were able to
do this do we think we can always do
this I don't know but the fact is we did
it once so we know it's entirely
possible to do so by the end of 2017 our
core data API is and data systems
running in AWS will be moving terabytes
of data and processing millions of
messages a day by the end of 2018 or AWS

over 500 million dollars in annual

we're shrinking our Shenzhen footprint
by moving our non production

four years we've created a cloud center

and we're about to launch a retraining

already in-house so while we're super
excited about cost efficiencies we're
even more excited about creating a
frictionless developer experience that
spurs innovation and increases
productivity
it's about simplifying it's about the

the pace of innovation the breadth of
